messages.message: Hey team, I’m looking at this PR (https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/52228) which I was not aware of, which flags the v2 flow editor as deprecated. In the description I see that this was intended to go into the release notes, but this does not appear to have happened. Did we signal to customers that we are deprecating flow v2 at some point as well as v1 (I’ve heard only about v1 internally and in the release notes), and if so, can someone point me to a timeline or discussion on this point? cc @Jessica

Flow v1 and v2 flow editor is really the same thing; these versions are probably not meaningful to external users. The idea is the old editor that creates the old version of flow will be deprecated; please use the new editor. We will support running the old version of flows probably forever but will no longer support creating / editing them. Any concerns about this?
Note that we mark the deprecation to begin the process; if anyone requires us to wait we will

Understood, we should seek to make this more clear in our documentation. We have not been relaying to customers at all anything about flow v2 (our documentation _only_ mentions flow v1), while we have been relaying info about flow v1. I will check with BofA (the main client still using v2) to see what their editing intentions are, but given their nature my presumption is they will say they need to keep it. Given that BofA is in a weird spot with professional services as well at the moment, it will be difficult to push them to migrate their existing flows imo.
@Kerry Thank you for the details! Per @Chuba’s point, we need to really clarify this in our release notes.
We had a ticket (https://instabase.zendesk.com/agent/tickets/7432) from BofA this morning that they encountered a deprecating warning for *flowV2* which we have not communicated out at all.

I see, I read the ticket -- with BofA, please let them know that this is just an announcement for deprecation -- they can still use it in 24.01 (I assume this is the version that they are getting). We always announce deprecation at least 3 releases before the feature actually gets removed. So this is not a blocker for them to upgrade to 24.01...
Yep, have relayed this to them :+1:
Can we please update the release notes adding FlowV2 as well? Thank you!
yes, let me sync with the team
